alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington and east central Hancock Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Deblois, or 8 miles west of Cherryfield, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherryfield, Steuben, Deblois, Franklin, Sullivan and Eastbrook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock
